title: Tomates Farcies au Porc MADIVIAL (Pork-Stuffed Tomatoes)

instructions.instruction_text: Cut the tops off the tomatoes and carefully hollow them out using a spoon, reserving the pulp. Set the tomato shells aside.
Chop the reserved tomato pulp and mix with a tablespoon of vinegar to create a sauce. Set aside.
Finely chop the onion, garlic, and vegetarian chili peppers.
Clean and finely chop the mushrooms into small pieces.
Mince the pork rib meat using a meat grinder or food processor, or ask your butcher to do this.
Heat olive oil in a large pan. Add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Add the minced pork to the pan and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned.
Add the chopped mushrooms, garlic, and chili peppers. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the mixture is well combined.
Fill each hollowed tomato with the pork and mushroom mixture, packing it in gently.
Place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish. Pour the tomato pulp sauce around them.
Bake at 180°C for 25 minutes until the tomatoes are tender and the filling is cooked through.
Serve hot with rice or crusty bread to soak up the delicious tomato sauce.
